content: oktoberfest hat a cozy thermal hat for autumn adventures… designed by sarah stewart this slouchy hat is knit with a textured stitch similar to thermal long underwear it s a quick knit and fits an average adult head supplies 275 yards sport weight yarn i used malabrigo arroyo in color marte a 16 inch us 5/3 75mm circular needle and us 5/3 75mm double pointed needles or size necessary to obtain gauge 1 stitch marker 1 locking stitch marker and a tapestry needle finished measurement un-stretched hat brim measures 19 around and will comfortably stretch to fit average adult 21-23 inch heads gauge 4 inches = 24 stitches and 39 row washed and blocked directions using 16 needle cast on 104 stitches using a stretchy cast on i prefer old norwegian cast on also referred to as german twisted i m half norwegian so i go with that place your marker and join in the round taking care not to twist your cast on stitches work in 1x1 twisted rib for 1 inch 1x1 twisted rib= k1tbl p1 to end of round begin thermal stitch pattern row 1 purl to end of round row 2 k1 p1 to end of round row 3 same as 2 repeat thermal stitch pattern until hat measures 9 inches from cast on ending after row 2 knit the next round row 3 onto your dpn s place a locking marker in the first stitch this will now be your beginning of round marker evenly distribute the stitches onto the dpn s 26 stitches on each needle designed by sarah stewart begin decreases next round is now row 1 a purl round work as follows p2tog purl to two stitches before end of needle p2tog repeat 3 more times to end of round 8 stitches decreased continue thermal stitch pattern working decrease round on row 1 until you have 14 stitches total on each needle you ll have worked the decrease round 6 times total now you will work decreases every round until you have 8 stitches left this part is a little tricky because you will be decreasing in pattern you ll have to read your knitting to know if it should be a knit decrease or a purl decrease just look at the second stitch before you decrease- and if it s a purl you will purl two together and if it s a knit you will knit two together the last round will end with 2 stitches on each needle cut your yarn leaving an 8 inch tail and use your tapestry needle to run the yarn through each of your stitches draw them up tight and then weave in your ends block your hat and you will be all set for an autumn adventure this pattern is free for you to do as you please i only request that you attribute the design to me if you decide to sell items made from it d if something is unclear or there
